info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 19 at 8:49PM CDT until May 21 at 1:04PM CDT by NWS Springfield MO
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri...Kansas...
Little Osage River near Horton affecting Vernon County.
Little Osage River at Fulton affecting Bourbon County.
Marmaton River at Fort Scott affecting Bourbon County.
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Missouri...
Marmaton River near Nevada affecting Vernon County.
For the Little Osage River...including Fulton, Horton...Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Marmaton River...including Fort Scott, Nevada...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Little Osage River at Fulton.
* WHEN...Until early Wednesday afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Farmland at the gage site becomes covered by flood waters, and Highway 31, east of town becomes flooded. Highway 31, four miles west of Fulton has flood waters four to six feet in depth.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM CDT Monday the stage was 13.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 22.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 26.8 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 26.7 feet on 03/21/2012. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Tuesday evening at 900 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON
